intro: Erlangea rogersii, commonly known as the Rogers' erlangea, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained, acidic soils and thrives in shaded to partially sunny environments. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, Erlangea rogersii is considered endangered in many of its native ranges.
